comments.text: Got a direct ride to Daegu after around 30minutes of waiting. It was already dark but still managed to get the ride. Cars would stop and tell us, that it's dangerous, that there is no way we can get a ride to Daegu (too far), but you should not be discouraged.

Get off at Yangjae Ciziten's Forest Station and walk to the intersection. You can actually get on the highway (be careful) and if you walk for about 200 meters, there is a service station. Wait at the end of the service station where cars slowly drive to the highway. I don't think you will wait more than 10 minutes. It's a good spot for heading south to Daejeon, Daegu or Busan. You can use a sign if you are willing to wait a bit longer to get a direct ride.
Perfect spot to get a ride west, towards Gwangju, Jinju or Jeonju. Waiting time is usually quite short

The toll gates 300 meter further on might be the better spot. However, as always, with a sign in Korean you'll never have to wait for long. Korea is probably one of the best countries to hitchhike in.
Waited for about 20 mins before I got a direct ride. Make a sign in Korean if you are directly going to Busan or Daegu.

Toll gate - excellent spot for rides north towards Gyeongju (10 minutes waiting time for a direct ride). To get here take the metro (Line 2) to Namyangsan station. From here it's a 20 minutes walk to the toll gates (cross the river on the foot bridge, turn left and walk along the small creek for 500 meter until you hit Yangsan-Daero Road. After you've passed under the highway, turn right and walk another 500 meter to the toll gates. Staff and police were indifferent to me standing on the highway

There are many people driving from Sokcho to Seoul. You just need to find a nice spot that is close to "Misiryeong Tunnel". You don't even need a sign as you can reject shorter rides and wait for a direct ride to Seoul.
Near by there is Lotte supermarket you have also quite a few other shops including one which sales lots of good sweets. It is easy to get a ride in both direction East and West.
It looks like it is a terrible place to hitchhike but actually is not that bad. I waited 10 minutes and got the car going all the way north.
There is a shop and restaurant, lots of buses and cars passing by. Average time of waiting 5 minutes.
Petrol stattion close by. Easy to hitchhike, it took me 5 minutes to catch a car.
Although there is not much traffic it is a good place :) I waited only 2 minute. (moving in direction of Boseong)
There is a firefighters station with parking space where you can safely go hitchhiking.
Drivers often have to stop because of the traffic lights, there is a place where you can comfortably stand and hitchhike.
Plenty of cars going both directions, bus stop is probably the best place to go hitchhiking. I waited only 2 minutes.
There is a bus stop, so drivers can easily stop to pick you up.
Traffic lights and petrol station on the side of the road make this place perfect for hitchhiking towards Jeju city.
Plenty of room for cars to stop of both sides of the road.
There is a bus stop where people sell fruits, easy to catch a car towards Wando.
There are quite a few bus stops on the way, lots of driver travel East, later inWolpyeongrii you can change to South towards Wando (ferries to Jeju island)
There is a bus bay where drivers can easily stop. If you are tired of walking its worth to give it a go here.
There are buses which stop near by but I walked from Muan.
It's easy to get here by tube, later there is 2-3km of walking, but the place is perfect because everyone go east.
There is a service area so you can either go to Busan or Gwangju. Go hitchhiking on tolgates.
There is a service area so you can either go to Busan or Gwangju. Go hitchhiking on tolgates.
On the way from the Taeon (when going South) there will be hospital and few hundred meters further local shop where quite a few stops stop. Its probably 2/3 km from city itself.
There is a lamp so drivers can see you pretty well even during evenings. Enough room to stop even for a proper lorry. Take some food with you because there is no grocery shop on the way.
Great place! plenty of room for cars to stop.
Close by there is a bus stop meaning that there is plenty of room to stop for a car. Good place for anyone who likes to go south (its not far away from highway's tollgates )
There is plenty of room to hitchhike next to the tollgates (Suwon). It's quite easy to get there from Kyung Hee University campus (I walked)

Really good place. The service area is reachable by bus + walk (bus n°4+ bus n°17, look on Naver map for the itinerary). We (a couple) waited 10min and got a direct ride to Sokcho (even if we had a sign for Hongcheon).
Thumb+sign.

Really good spot. The service area is reachable by foot + by bus from the Andong bus terminal (only 4 or 5 bus per day). We (a couple) waited less than 5minutes.
Thumb+sign.
Gas station just before expressway entrance, lots of traffic and two options to go south from here

I'm a 25-year-old Caucasian man. I had a clear sign that read in Hangul "Please, bring me to Busan," I found success within three minutes by standing between the two roads leading to the tollgate near the traffic light.
Great spot and the staff of the toll gate can’t bother you.
Good place with enough space and cars taking the highway for long trips.
Nice place to catch a ride, its after the traffic light so car are going slowly !

Just before the tunnel there is some space to stop. Cars go really fast (it'a a highway) but it's easy to pass the fence - there is some kind of a gate). Had to wait for around 10 minutes to get a direct ride to Andong.
Not a perfect spot - not much space to stop for a driver, but still managed to get a direct ride to Busan in around 10-15 minutes.

Good spot to hitch a ride towards Andong or Seoul. There is a way around to get behind the toll gates. Wait there with a sign of your destination and there are big chances that you will get a direct ride.
Great spot to get a direct ride to Busan. Took me 5 minutes to get one
Wait a few meters after the toll gate where the cars can stop. Many trucks going to Busan.

Hitching spot basically on the on-ramp to the highway. There's enough space for a car to pull over. Lot's of traffic. 20 minutes waiting time for a direct ride to Daejeon. Works best with a sign in Korean I guess. To get here take the metro to Yongsan station. From here it's only 300 meter to the highway. Simply walk up to the highway and hope for the best. It's Korea (hitchhiking paradise), so don't worry.
Busy road sa its quite easy to get a ride to north.
There is petrol station and grocery shop on the other side of the road. Good spot mainly because there is lots of cars passing by .
Traffic system force drivers to slowdown. Good place when movind in Eastern direction.

Good spot to go to Daegu. We (a couple) waited first at the exit of the SA but wasn't good place so we moved closer to the tolls gate and it worked better. We had a direct ride to Daegu. 
Thumb+sign.
Dobra miejscówka, ze względu na duża widoczność i światła, które części kierowców pozwalają na dłuższe  przyjrzenie się nam.

I'm a 25-year-old Caucasian man. I waited there for an hour, and then the police arrived. They took me to the police station and put me on a bus to Seoul, my final destination. I believe the location is good; I was just unlucky. The cars were driving fast, so you should have a large sign indicating Daejeon or Seoul in Hangul.
Nice spot to get a ride towards Seoul or Daejeon. Wait just before ofrafter the toll gates. It took me around 15-20 minutes to get direct ride to Seoul (before the tollgates)
If you want to go to Jangseong or Jeongeup, stay here. and I heard that some foreign hitchhiker shout Seoul.

Not much space to stop, but still managed to get a direct ride to Daegu within 5minutes. If you're luck you will get a ride fast. If you're not you will have to wait a little longer but someone will take you sonner or later. To get there take the metro line number 2 to 동의대 (dong eui univ. exit 4)
Managed to get a direct ride to Goje Island in around 10 minutes. If you're lucky you will get a ride quite fast.
One day I waited here 1,5h and the other 5 minutes, you never know when you will have a lucky day. Place it's good seems to be that is best to hitchhike during the day
plenty of room for cars to stop, unfortunately I was hitchhiking during the night and not many people payed enough attentions I change the place after 15minutes

Its better to go somewhere further   away if you are travelling East. For Ggotij beach follow street there will be a few good places near by. There is also grocery shop and small restaurant with traditional food (very popular among lorry drivers).
It took me little while to catch a car there, but there is not many other good places there. Try to stay right on the tollgates usually its faster.

In South Korea usually nobody's hitch-hiking and it's not common at all! Still people can pick you up out of curiosity and also because they are really very helpful. You can try, but don't be surprised if nobody stops.
Hodně málo místa na zastavení ale je tam chodník, kde si lze udělat základnu, super místo pro ty co chtějí na jih.

Bad spot if you want to get a ride to Andong or anywhere further. Everyone takes the highway to go to other cities, On highway (toll gates) it takes 10-15 minutes to get a ride, here we waited for around 45 minutes and no one stopped (except for taxis)
Cars go pretty fast here, that's why this spot is not perfect, but there is quite a lot of space to stop. Traffic is ok. Managed to get the direct ride to Daegu in less then 15minutes
Low traffic, I would suggest to go somewhere else
not very good place mainly because of lack of space to stop
small chances that there is going to be anyone who will stop for you as there is big traffic and not much room for safty break.
that's pretty bad place as the street its really wide and drivers dont have a chance to stop. Its better to go to tollgates (north) or (south)  to exress way.
I hitchhiked when it was dark so you may have better results during the day.
If you want to go from Ggotij beach in Eastern direction is better to travel on the road located along the shore (is not shown on this map)
